duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform venipuncture and capillary collections appropriate for the patient's age, professionally, and with minimal discomfort according to laboratory policy.
Accurately distribute reports according to procedures at each site and review reports as directed by the site manager.

Use the Laboratory Information system and other systems related to the management of patient orders and payment reconciliation. Includes patient registration, payment processing, laboratory order retrieval, and test ordering.
Follow all laboratory procedures for proper patient identification and specimen labeling.
Follow CAP, CLIA, and other accreditation and safety guidelines as described in their respective guidelines.
Attend department meetings and complete training and education activities as assigned by the laboratory manager.

education_certification.credential: High school diploma or GED (required). Phlebotomy skills required for lab assistants working in locations that perform specimen collection; previous work experience with phlebotomy or the successful completion of a phlebotomy training course is strongly preferred.
